alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Blaine; Garfield; Grant; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Woods (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 2:29AM CDT until May 19 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN KINGFISHER...NORTHEASTERN WOODS...ALFALFA...NORTHEASTERN BLAINE...GRANT...NORTHWESTERN LOGAN...GARFIELD AND EASTERN MAJOR COUNTIES... At 229 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Capron to 5 miles northwest of Goltry to 3 miles southeast of Lahoma to 4 miles southwest of Hennessey, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Enid, Cherokee, Medford, Hennessey, Helena, Waukomis, Pond Creek, Garber, Lahoma, Covington, Ringwood, Dover, Drummond, Lamont, Carmen, Wakita, Cleo Springs, Marshall, Kremlin and Goltry. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Alfalfa; Blaine; Garfield; Grant; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Woods
